messages.title: Delivering for South East Cambs
messages.content: With the election fast approaching, the choice in South East Cambridgeshire is between the sitting Conservative MP and local Lib Dem campaigner Jonathan Chatfield.

messages.title: Campaigning for the real change we need
messages.content: Only a vote for Jonathan will deliver the real change we need in South East Cambs.

messages.title: Labour are out of the race here
messages.content: At the last local elections they only received 7% of the vote.

messages.title: It's Jonathan or the Conservative here
messages.content: Labour can't win in South East Cambs. Voting for them will just help elect a Conservative MP. Only a vote for Jonathan Chatfield will bring real change for our area.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrat Pupil Premium will pump £2.5 billion extra investment into our primary schools, targeting the poorest children.
Nick Clegg's tax plan means that you will pay no tax on the first £10,000 you earn - cutting most tax bills by £700.
Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg and Shadow Chancellor Vince Cable would create thousands of new jobs in sustainable industries, to help boost the economy and tackle climate change.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour can't win in South East Cambs. Voting for them will just help elect a Conservative MP.

issues.economy: Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg and Shadow Chancellor Vince Cable would create thousands of new jobs in sustainable industries, to help boost the economy and tackle climate change.
issues.education: The Liberal Democrat Pupil Premium will pump £2.5 billion extra investment into our primary schools, targeting the poorest children.
issues.health: Jonathan and his young family know the importance of good local schools and hospitals.

leaflet.personalStatement: Jonathan lives in Impington, in the heart of the constituency. Jonathan has 20 years experience in business and will be a hard working MP.

images.caption: Jonathan Chatfield talking to young people about Lib Dem plans to abolish tuition fees.
Jonathan Chatfield campaigning with Liberal Democrat councillors against Tory cuts to Ely market earlier this year.
Local election results in South East Cambs, June 2009.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Jonathan's pledge to YOU: - Jonathan has pledged to have a constituency office open five days per week and hold regular local surgeries. - Jonathan will publish all his parliamentary expenses on his website and never seek to profit from his role as your MP. - Jonathan will always put the interests of South East Cambs ahead of party politics.
